patterns: what are the courses offered in your college?
what are the courses in UNI?
can you tell me the courses available in UNI?
can you tell me the branches available in UNI?
responses:
At MCE College, we offer Bachelor of Technology(BTech) course in the following branches:
- Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
- Computer Science and Engineering in Artificial Intelligence (CSE-AI)
- Civil Engineering
- Mechanical Engineering
- Electrical and Electronics Communication (EEE)

patterns: what is the fee of each semester
what is the fees of each year
tell me something about the fees
What is the fees of hostel
fees for Ac room for girls
fees for non-Ac room for girls
fees for Ac room for boys
fees for non-Ac room for boys
responses:
MCE College has two main types of fees: Academic fees and Hostel fees.

Academic fees:
- Admission Charge with Development charge (1st year): $3030
- Registration charge: $2100
- Per Semester form fees: $3700 for General, OBC & EBC and $700 for SC & ST
- Development Charge per year: $2644 for General, OBC & EBC and $2500 for SC & ST

Hostel fees:
- Old Hostel fees for both Boys' & Girls' Hostel: $38,000 during allotment (12 months maintenance + 6 months mess + $5000 for Security money), then $1250 per month for maintenance and $3000 for mess.
- New Hostel fees for both Boys' & Girls' Hostel: $41,000 during allotment (12 months maintenance + 6 months mess + $5000 for Security money), then $1500 per month for maintenance and $3000 for mess.

For more Infromation Contact the OBH caretaker 'Durgesh Sir' phone no: 6205779562

patterns: what is the address of college
responses: MCE College is located in Fursatpur, Bariyarpur, Motihari, Bihar, 845401. You can find the location [here](Google Maps).

patterns: how far is hostel from college
responses:
MCE College offers accommodation in 5 hostels, catering to both boys and girls:

For Boys:
1. Old Boys Hostel
2. New Boys Hostel
3. Balak Chhatrawas

For Girls:
1. Old Girls Hostel
2. Balika Chhatrawas

Each hostel provides separate mess services for the convenience of students.

patterns: documents needed at the time of admission
documents required at the time of admission
What document are required for admission
Which document to bring for admission
what documents do I need for admission
responses:
To take admission in MCE College, you will need the following documents:

For UGEAC Admission:
1. Original copy of JEE Main admit card
2. Original copy of JEE Main score card
3. Passing Certificate / Mark sheet / Admit Card of class 10
4. Passing Certificate / Mark sheet / Admit Card of class 12/ equivalent exam.
5. Residential Certificate (Domicile)
6. Caste Certificate (If applicable)
7. Three copies of the Provisional seat allotment letter
8. Six copies of the passport size photographs, same as pasted on the Admit Card of JEE Main.
9. Downloaded print of online filled application form (Part A & Part B) of UGEAC
10. Aadhar Card.
11. Any other documents required (if any) such as DQ (PH) certificate
12. Print copy of slip of filled choices
13. All the Certificate / documents in original as per the requirements of admissions in Government Engineering Colleges

For BCECE-LE Admission:
1. Original copy of BCECE-LE admit card
2. Original copy of BCECE-LE Rank card
3. Passing Certificate / Mark sheet / Admit Card of class 10
4. Passing Certificate / All semester Mark sheet of Diploma or equivalent exam.
5. Residential Certificate (Domicile)
6. Caste Certificate (If applicable)
7. Three copies of the Provisional seat allotment letter
8. Six copies of the passport size photographs, same as pasted on the Admit Card of BCECE-LE Exam.
9. Downloaded print of online filled application form (Part A & Part B) of BCECE-LE
10. Aadhar Card.
11. Any other documents required (if any) such as DQ (PH) certificate
12. Print copy of slip of filled choices
13. All the Certificate / documents in original as per the requirements of admissions in Government Engineering Colleges

patterns: How can I apply for a scholarship?
responses:
There is a scholarship scheme provided by the Bihar government for Engineering students called the 'Post Matric Scholarship, Bihar'. To apply, you need to visit the official website of the Post Matric Scholarship Scheme: [PMSONLINE Portal](https://www.pmsonline.bih.nic.in/). You'll need to submit the following required documents on the portal:

- Student Aadhaar card
- Student photograph
- Bonafide certificate from institution
- Fee receipt from institution
- Income certificate
- Residence certificate
- Caste certificate
- Previous degree passing certificate
- Previous year mark sheet

After applying online, you are required to submit the hard copy of the application along with the required documents to the college.

To get the Bonafide certificate and Fee structure, you have to meet 'Bhushan Sir' at the new academic building office. For more information, you can also visit this unofficial website: [Bihar Post Matric Scholarship - A Guide for Students](https://vakilsearch.com/blog/bihar-post-matric-scholarship-a-guide-for-students/)

patterns: Is there a gym available on campus?
Does the college have a gym?
Is there a fitness center in the college?
responses: Yes, Gym is available in this college.

patterns: How to get a loan for education
responses:
This college is in the Approved college list for Bihar Student Credit Card loan scheme by the government of Bihar. You can apply for this scheme from your home district DRCC office.

Required Documents To Apply For BSCCS:
- 10th, 12th Mark sheet
- Residence Certificate
- Proof of selection by the Educational Institute
- Bonafide Certificate with course session mentioned
- Fee Structure of College
- Application Form with passport size photos
- Bank statement of Parent
- Aadhar Card of the applicant and their Parents
- Passport size photo of parents
- Income Certificate
- PAN Card

Additional documents may be required according to DRCC. To get the Bonafide certificate and Fee structure, you have to meet 'Bhushan Sir' at the office of new academic building Ground floor Room no 009

patterns: How to get money back from college?
responses:
To get back the loan amount or money from the college account, you have to write an application and visit the old academic building office with the required documents listed below:
- Handwritten Application with no dues from hostel
- Disbursement Detail of payment
- Sanction letter
- Development Charge payment proof
- Bank Passbook photocopy
Our university's Engineering department provides fully AC Lab with internet connection, smart classroom, Auditorium, library,canteen

patterns: Where can I get Fee Structure?
Fee structure for BSCC loan scheme
responses: To get the Bonafide certificate and Fee structure for Scholarship or BSCC Loan Scheme, you have to meet 'Bhushan Sir' at the office of the new academic building Ground floor Room no 009

patterns: How to make subsequent payment for BSCC loan?
Procedure for BSCC loan subsequent payment
responses: To apply for BSCC loan subsequent payment, you have to download the 'Self Declaration form' from the BSCC official website. Then, you need your last exam passing marksheet verified by the Exam cell. Lastly, you need to obtain a 'Promotion Letter' from the college. To get the Promotion letter, you have to meet 'Bhushan Sir' at the office of the new academic building Ground floor Room no 009

patterns: is ragging practice active in college
does college have any antiragging facility
responses: We are proud to assure you that our college provides a safe and ragging-free environment, with strict rules against ragging. If you have faced any incidents of ragging, we encourage you to report it immediately. Please register your ragging complaint through the following link: [Report Ragging](https://www.antiragging.in/complaint_register_form.html)

To know more about Training and Placement opportunities, please visit the links below:
- Official Training & Placement Page: [T&P Page](https://www.mcemotihari.ac.in/training-and-placement/about-placement/)
- Official LinkedIn Page: [LinkedIn Page](https://www.linkedin.com/company/tnpmce/)

Our college offers comprehensive medical facilities to ensure the well-being of our students. We provide a free ambulance service on campus to promptly attend to any medical emergencies and transport students to nearby hospitals if necessary. Additionally, we have trained medical staff available for first aid and basic healthcare services.

Our college is equipped with an ATM conveniently located on campus, providing easy access to banking services for students and staff. The ATM ensures that you can conveniently withdraw cash and perform other banking transactions without having to leave the campus premises.

In our college, we have a cyber cafe conveniently combined with a general shop to cater to all your computing and daily needs. The cyber cafe provides internet access, printing services, and other computer facilities. For more information, please contact the cyber cafe owner, Santosh Kumar, at phone number 8102336478.

patterns: Motihari College Of Engineering Alumni Association
responses:
There are multiple clubs in our college catering to different interests and purposes:

- Technical Clubs: E-yantra Club (EEE), CIVIC Club (CE)
- Hackathons: Zero One Coding Club
- Internships: Training & Placement Cell
- Entrepreneurship Clubs: E-Cell (Startup)
- Social Service Clubs: NSS Volunteers Club
- Sports and Fitness: Parakram Club
- Cultural and Performing Arts: Rit Club
- Debating and Public Speaking: Srijan Club
- Technical Competitions: Avishkar Innovation & Robotics Club
- Networking Events: Motihari College Of Engineering Alumni Association (MCEAA) Club

For specific clubs:
- For Zero One Coding Club, visit [Zero One Coding Club Website](https://zeroonemce.com/) or contact Chanda Kumar Singh at 6200952129.
- For Startup Cell, contact Abhinandan Kumar at 9708470467.
- For any other club inquiries, contact Raushan Kumar at 7281887889.
The number of seats available for students per branch for every batch is approximately 70, with 60 seats for regular admissions and 10 seats for lateral entry.
This college was established in 1980.

In the course curriculum, there are two major projects in the final year, with the first project scheduled in the 7th semester and the second project in the 8th semester for every branch. Each project carries 6 credits.

Additionally, there are some optional minor projects you can do.

In the course curriculum, students are required to complete a minimum of three internships during their academic tenure for all branches.

The schedule for internships is as follows:

1. First Internship: To be completed in the 3rd semester, lasting a minimum of 4 weeks. It carries 4 credits.

2. Second Internship: To be completed in the 5th semester, lasting a minimum of 4 weeks. It carries 4 credits.

3. Third Internship: To be completed in the 7th semester, lasting a minimum of 8 weeks. It carries 8 credits.

 After completion of intenship student has to submit the Intenship Certificate to their Department.

Throughout the BTech session, students are required to submit two certificates from NPTEL in different subjects.

The NPTEL certificate examination carries a total of 100 marks, with the passing mark set at 40.

It's important to note that only passing certificates of NPTEL exams are considered valid.

Each NPTEL certificate carries 4 credits.

Therefore, it's advisable to earn the passing certificate of NPTEL exams as soon as possible.

There isn't a specified formula provided by the university to convert CGPA to percentage. However, as per faculty suggestion, you can multiply your CGPA by 9.5 to obtain the percentage equivalent.

For example, if your CGPA is 8.16, the calculation would be: 8.16 x 9.5 = 77.52%
Currently, M.Tech course is not available in this college. However, the Bihar government is planning to include M.Tech course in Government Engineering Colleges.

The Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) is an entrance exam primarily for postgraduate programs such as M.Tech, MS Research, and others in engineering and science disciplines.

Additionally, some Public Sector Undertaking (PSU) companies use GATE scores for recruiting engineers, providing numerous career opportunities.

GATE offers a chance to pursue higher studies in prestigious institutions like the IITs and NITs.

B.Tech students are eligible to attempt the GATE exam from their 3rd year of study.

It's important to note that no leave is provided by the college to prepare for this examination, so students should start preparing from their 2nd year itself to maximize their chances of success.
The area of the MCE Motihari college is 58 acres.
